page.title: 13FLORA DOWNLAND MINAL
page.content: This area of soil, largely consisting of clay and flints, hass a wide variety of species in the hedgerows. The trees observed include ash, beech, blackthorn, crab-apple, elder, haathorn, hazel, holly, honeysuckle, ivy,(field) maple, (wild)rose, oak, spindle and viburnum/antane. Some regenerating elm is evident, and recent new planting has consisted of ash and wild cherry. Along the hedgerows and tracks a variety of common wild flowers grow in profusion including agrimony, bramble, broadleaved willowherb, chickweed, common poppy,common catasear, cow-parsley,greater and lesser stitchwort, heartstongue fern, hempnettle, herb raobert, hogweed, meadow-buttercup, meadow cranesbill, pink campion,red campion, rough hawksbeard perforated StJohnswort
